posts.author: BardTales
posts.content:
I've been thinking about uses lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about uses that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with uses and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about uses?

posts.author: BarbarianBob
posts.content:
In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how Creative works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use Creative to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

When DMing, I like to use Creative as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

posts.author: MonkeyBusinessDM
posts.content:
Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that uses functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how uses works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

Our table uses a house rule for uses where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.
